\documentclass[american]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{esint}
\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
\title{A Simplified Sweat Capital Model}

\maketitle
I want to start with a simplified sweat capital model. The key features
that I would like are
\begin{enumerate}
\item Two types of capital
\item Occupation choice
\end{enumerate}
%
Hopefully the model retains all the key economics and is easy to solve
and code up. Let me start with the dynamic programs of owners and
workers.

\section{Time investment}

\subsection{Dynamic programs}

\paragraph{Owners}

\[
V^{b}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\max_{c,a^{\prime}\geq0,\kappa^{\prime}}u(c)-g(e)+\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
c+a^{\prime}=y^{b}\left(\kappa,s\right)+Ra
\]
\[
\kappa^{\prime}=\left(1-\delta_{\kappa}\right)\kappa+e
\]


\paragraph{Workers
\[
V^{w}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\max_{c,a^{\prime}\protect\geq0}u(c)+\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
c+a^{\prime}=y^{w}\left(s\right)+Ra
\]
\[
\kappa^{\prime}=\lambda\kappa
\]
}

\paragraph{Occupational choice
\[
V\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\protect\int\max_{d}\left(d\left[V^{b}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)+\eta\right]+\left(1-d\right)\left[V^{w}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)\right]\right)d\Gamma\left(\eta\right)
\]
}

\subsection{Application of Endogenous grid}

The optimality of owners and workers is given by 

\[
u_{c}\left(c\right)-\lambda=\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V_{a}\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
\lambda a^{\prime}=0,\quad\lambda\geq0,\quad a^{\prime}\ge0
\]
\[
g_{e}\left(e\right)=\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V_{\kappa}\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]

\begin{itemize}
\item Assume that we have a guess for $V$ and via that we obtain $\left\{ V_{a},V_{\kappa}\right\} $
\item We can back out functions $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
assuming the EE holds with equality
\item Using $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
we can back out $\left\{ A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
as the associated levels of assets and sweat capital today
\item Now we need to interpolate. Suppose $A\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right)>0$,
under some conditions {[}?{]} should be that the borrowing constraint
binds. 
\begin{itemize}
\item let $\left\{ \left(A\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right)\right\} _{\kappa^{\prime}}$
be the cutoffs. Suppose they are well-behaved, that is they nicely
segment $A\times K$ space into a region $R^{-}\subseteq A\times K$
where the constraint binds and a region $R^{+}$ where it doesn't. 
\item For $\left(a,\kappa\right)\in R^{-}$ we can use $C^{min}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=y^{b}\left(\kappa,s\right)+Ra$
. We can add these points
\item Elsewere we use $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} $
to interpolate 
\end{itemize}
\item For $E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)$ we can just use
$\left\{ E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} $
\item Using the interpolations we can obtain $V^{b}$
\item Something analogous should give us $V^{w}$
\item Then the discrete choice is closed form and gives us $d$ as well
as the new guess for $V$
\end{itemize}

\section{Money investment}

\subsection{Dynamic programs}

\paragraph{Owners}

\[
V^{b}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\max_{c,a^{\prime}\geq0,\kappa^{\prime}}u(c)+\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
c+a^{\prime}=y^{b}\left(\kappa,s\right)+Ra-e
\]
\[
\kappa^{\prime}=\left(1-\delta_{\kappa}\right)\kappa+g\left(e\right)
\]


\paragraph{Workers
\[
V^{w}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\max_{c,a^{\prime}\protect\geq0}u(c)+\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
c+a^{\prime}=y^{w}\left(s\right)+Ra
\]
\[
\kappa^{\prime}=\lambda\kappa
\]
}

\paragraph{Occupational choice
\[
V\left(a,\kappa,s\right)=\protect\int\max_{d}\left(d\left[V^{b}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)+\eta\right]+\left(1-d\right)\left[V^{w}\left(a,\kappa,s\right)\right]\right)d\Gamma\left(\eta\right)
\]
}

\subsection{Application of Endogenous grid}

The optimality of owners and workers is given by 

\[
u_{c}\left(c\right)-\lambda=\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V_{a}\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)
\]
\[
\lambda a^{\prime}=0,\quad\lambda\geq0,\quad a^{\prime}\ge0
\]
\[
\frac{u_{c}\left(c\right)}{g_{e}\left(e\right)}=\underbrace{\beta\sum_{s}\Pi(s^{\prime}|s)V_{\kappa}\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s^{\prime}\right)}_{\chi}
\]

\begin{itemize}
\item Assume that we have a guess for $V$ and via that we obtain $\left\{ V_{a},V_{\kappa}\right\} $
\item There exists functions $C^{min}\left(a,\kappa^{\prime},\chi\right),E^{min}\left(a,\kappa^{\prime},\chi\right),K^{min}\left(a,\kappa^{\prime},\chi\right)$
that satisfy 
\[
\frac{u_{c}\left(c\right)}{g_{e}\left(e\right)}=\chi
\]
\[
c=y^{b}\left(\kappa,s\right)+Ra-e
\]
\[
\kappa^{\prime}=\left(1-\delta_{\kappa}\right)\kappa+g\left(e\right)
\]
\item We can back out functions $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
assuming the EE holds with equality
\item Using $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
we can back out $\left\{ A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} _{A^{\prime}\times K^{\prime}\times S}$
as the associated levels of assets and sweat capital today
\item Now we need to interpolate. Suppose $A\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right)>0$,
under some conditions {[}?{]} should be that the borrowing constraint
binds. 
\begin{itemize}
\item let $\left\{ \left(A\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(0,\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right)\right\} _{\kappa^{\prime}}$
be the cutoffs. Suppose they are well-behaved, that is they nicely
segment $A\times K$ space into a region $R^{-}\subseteq A\times K$
where the constraint binds and a region $R^{+}$ where it doesn't. 
\item For $\left(a,\kappa\right)\in R^{-}$ we can use $\left\{ C^{min}\left(a,\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K^{min}\left(a,\kappa^{\prime},\chi\right)\right\} _{a<A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)}$
. We can add these points
\item Elsewere we use $\left\{ C\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),A\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right),K\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)\right\} $
to interpolate 
\item Same for $E\left(a^{\prime},\kappa^{\prime},s\right)$ 
\end{itemize}
\item Using the interpolations we can obtain $V^{b}$
\item Something analogous should give us $V^{w}$
\item Then the discrete choice is closed form and gives us $d$ as well
as the new guess for $V$
\end{itemize}

\end{document}
